meanings.sent1: The town was wary of the varlets who roamed the streets at night.
meanings.sent2: The community worked together to expose the varlets in their midst.
meanings.sent3: The varlets tried to trick the villagers, but their plans always backfired.
meanings.sent4: Beneath his charming facade, he was a varlet, deceiving all who trusted him.
meanings.sent5: The varlets' deceitful ways left a trail of broken promises and shattered dreams.

meanings.definition: A servant or attendant, especially a dishonest or disreputable one.
meanings.sent1: The castle employed varlets to tend to the needs of the nobles.
meanings.sent2: The varlets scurried around, carrying out their tasks with sly smiles.
meanings.sent3: The varlets played pranks on each other during their breaks, much to the amusement of the household.
meanings.sent4: The varlets' loyalty was as fleeting as the shadows they moved in.
meanings.sent5: The varlets' presence in the manor was like a dark cloud hanging over the grand halls.
